TITLE: Retailers begin reporting this week, but the delta variant is a big wild card
SUMMARY: Big retailers get their time to shine as they report earnings this week. The question is whether they can maintain momentum through the rest of 2021.

TITLE: Disney beats expectations across the board, with U.S. parks returning to profit
SUMMARY: The company beat on subscriber estimates for Disney+, coming in at 116 million.

TITLE: Airbnb shares fall after company reports revenue jump of 300% but warns about delta
SUMMARY: Airbnb's revenue came in at $1.34 billion, up nearly 300% year over year.

TITLE: Palantir revenue jumps 49% in second quarter
SUMMARY: Palantir's business has gotten a boost from the pandemic, and it recently extended contracts with government health agencies.

TITLE: Chinese Tesla rival Nio narrows losses as revenue surges 127%
SUMMARY: Amid the global chip shortage, the Nio CEO said the firm has been "working closely" with its partners to "improve the overall supply chain production capacity."

TITLE: Coinbase profits surge following volatile stretch of cryptocurrency trading
SUMMARY: While the company offered no formal guidance, it did say trading volume will be lower in the third quarter compared with Q2.

TITLE: Doximity shares jump after digital health company says revenue doubled in first report since IPO
SUMMARY: Doximity said revenue in the fiscal first quarter climbed to $72.7 million from $36.4 million a year earlier.

TITLE: AMC posts narrower-than-expected loss, but CEO warns theater chain is 'not yet out of the woods'
SUMMARY: Shares of AMC Entertainment rose after the company posted a narrower-than-expected loss during the second quarter.

TITLE: Berkshire Hathaway's operating earnings jump 21% as recovering economy boosts railroad, energy units
SUMMARY: The conglomerate reported operating earnings of $6.686 billion, up 21% from $5.513 billion a year ago,

TITLE: Norwegian Cruise Line posts mixed results ahead of first U.S. voyage since last year
SUMMARY: Norwegian Cruise Line reported mixed second-quarter results as future bookings remained strong ahead of its first cruise in the U.S. since last year.

TITLE: Huawei chairman says the ‘aim is to survive’ as revenue slides 29%
SUMMARY: The chairman of Huawei said the Chinese technology company's "aim is to survive" as revenue fell almost 30% in the first half of the year.

TITLE: The world's largest container shipping firm posts soaring second-quarter earnings
SUMMARY: Maersk has posted a sharp increase in second-quarter earnings as congestions and bottlenecks continue to drive up shipping rates.

TITLE: Cloud stocks soar to fresh records as Datadog's results help boost Cloudflare and Asana
SUMMARY: Datadog shares jumped 15% on Thursday on better-than-expected results, helping push other cloud stocks to all-time highs.

TITLE: Virgin Galactic reopens ticket sales, with prices starting at $450,000 per seat
SUMMARY: Virgin Galactic delivered second-quarter results after the market closed on Thursday and announced the reopening of ticket sales for spaceflights.

TITLE: Beyond Meat's loss widens amid higher costs, shares fall as pandemic clouds outlook
SUMMARY: Beyond Meat's shares fell in extended trading Thursday after the company reported a wider-than-expected loss for its second quarter.

TITLE: Novavax delays Covid vaccine emergency authorization submission to FDA until fourth quarter
Wayfair shares surge after earnings top estimates and sales stay above pre-pandemic levels
SUMMARY: Online furniture retailer Wayfair said active customers grew to 31.1 million, a nearly 20% year-over-year increase.

TITLE: Moderna says its Covid vaccine booster produced ‘robust’ immune response against delta
SUMMARY: Moderna said its Covid-19 vaccine booster shot produced a "robust" antibody response against the highly contagious delta variant.

TITLE: Singapore's largest bank reports 37% on-year jump in second-quarter profit, beats expectations
SUMMARY: DBS Group Holdings' net profit for the April-to-June quarter jumped 37% from a year ago to 1.7 billion Singapore dollars ($1.26 billion).

TITLE: Adidas raises outlook despite falling sales in China as boycott there continues
SUMMARY: The German sportswear giant increased its outlook for the year, despite a drop in sales in Greater China.

TITLE: Etsy stock plunges as weak guidance suggests pandemic e-commerce boom is stalling
SUMMARY: Etsy shares slid in extended trading Wednesday after the company gave third-quarter guidance that suggested a sales slowdown after the pandemic e-commerce bump.

TITLE: Roku stock sinks after company reports tight hardware margins, dramatic fall in streaming viewership
SUMMARY: Roku shares fell Wednesday after the company reported earnings that beat expectations but showed a slowdown in streaming TV viewing and tight hardware margins.

TITLE: Uber beats estimates, but core business loses $509 million in Q2
SUMMARY: Uber beat estimates on the top and bottom line and turned an unexpected one-time profit during the second quarter.

TITLE: Frontier Airlines lowers forecast after delta variant hurt bookings
SUMMARY: Budget airline Frontier says the coronavirus delta variant is driving down bookings.

TITLE: Royal Caribbean posts wider-than-expected loss as Covid delta variant hurts its ability to fill ships this summer
SUMMARY: Royal Caribbean reported second-quarter results with a wider-than-expected loss and a disappointing revenue.

TITLE: General Motors misses Wall Street second-quarter earnings expectations, raises 2021 guidance
SUMMARY: GM said quarterly earnings were dragged down by some $1.3 billion in warranty recall costs, including $800 million related to the Chevrolet Bolt EV.

TITLE: CVS Health raises estimates after strong earnings, but shares fall on investment plans
SUMMARY: The drugstore chain said its business has begun to normalize, as customers buy more items in the front of the store and pharmacists fill more prescriptions.

TITLE: Germany’s Commerzbank reports second-quarter loss as restructuring, write-off charges bite
SUMMARY: Commerzbank on Wednesday reported a net second-quarter loss due to restructuring costs and an exceptional write-off to an outsourcing project.

TITLE: A 'roaring era' for concerts and live events is coming, says Live Nation CEO
SUMMARY: Live Nation's Ticketmaster just had one of its best months ever in North America, a sign that audiences are ready to venture outside the home.

TITLE: Synthetic biology company Zymergen plunges 68% after saying product revenue will be 'immaterial' in 2022, removing CEO
SUMMARY: Three months after its IPO, Zymergen is warning investors that revenue is much further out than expected.

TITLE: Zoom shares slide 10% on slowing growth
SUMMARY: Zoom's full-year revenue guidance came in right where analysts expected. The earnings forecast is what was strong.

TITLE: Peloton shares fall after cycle maker posts disappointing earnings and outlook, cuts Bike price
SUMMARY: Peloton reported Thursday that revenue growth in its fiscal fourth quarter tapered off dramatically from the prior quarter.

TITLE: Salesforce raises full-year earnings guidance following its acquisition of Slack
SUMMARY: Salesforce will gain $530 million in revenue in the current fiscal year thanks to a contribution from Slack, a $27.7 billion acquisition that closed in July.

TITLE: Ulta shares rise after beauty retailer posts 60% gain in revenue as makeup sales recover
SUMMARY: Shares of Ulta Beauty rose in extended trading after the retailer posted second-quarter results that topped analyst expectations on the top and bottom lines.

TITLE: Dick's Sporting Goods shares rise after second-quarter sales surge 21%, retailer raises forecast
SUMMARY: The big-box retailer's sales have soared during the pandemic, as customers have bought workout clothes, sneakers, golf clubs and other outdoor equipment.

TITLE: Eyeglass retailer Warby Parker in IPO filing reveals rising sales—but also widening losses
SUMMARY: The brand, which is best known for selling lower-priced, fashion-forward prescription glasses, is preparing to debut on Wall Street.

TITLE: Nordstrom earnings beat, retailer raises forecast, but shares fall as sales still below 2019 levels
SUMMARY: Nordstrom reported fiscal second-quarter profit and sales that topped analysts' estimates.

TITLE: Best Buy shares rise on earnings beat, retailer says consumers are upgrading tech to work at home
SUMMARY: The consumer electronics retailer said it has benefited from a healthy consumer, government stimulus and permanent lifestyle changes.

TITLE: Foot Locker shares soar on huge earnings beat and on retailer's optimism for 2H
SUMMARY: Foot Locker crushed fiscal second-quarter earnings estimates and voiced optimism about the back half of the year.

TITLE: Victoria's Secret shares tumble, Bath & Body Works rises after first post-split earnings reports
SUMMARY: Victoria's Secret said its sales have yet to return to pre-pandemic levels, while Bath & Body Works is optimistic about its fall and holiday lineup.

TITLE: Kohl's shares surge after earnings top estimates, retailer raises forecast as higher foot traffic drives sales
SUMMARY: Kohl's said its higher forecast positions the department store to achieve many of its 2023 strategic goals this year, well ahead of plan.

TITLE: Macy's shares soar as earnings trounce estimates, retailer says it's gaining new customers online
SUMMARY: Macy's also reinstated its dividend and said its board approved a $500 million stock buyback program.

TITLE: Robinhood revenue doubles last quarter, but stock drops 8% after app warns trading is slowing
SUMMARY: Robinhood reported second-quarter earnings after the bell on Wednesday, in its first report since going public.

TITLE: Robinhood says dogecoin accounted for 62% of crypto revenue in Q2
SUMMARY: Robinhood, which derives significant revenue from crypto trading, announced earnings on Wednesday for the first time since its IPO last month.

TITLE: Nvidia beats earnings expectations, but cryptocurrency chip sales falter
SUMMARY: Nvidia's cryptocurrency chip product, CMP, had lower sales than the company predicted in May.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond shares dive more than 20% as supply chain issues hit sales, inflation eats into profits
SUMMARY: Bed Bath & Beyond shares tanked Thursday as the company said it saw a steep drop-off in traffic in August.

TITLE: Nike shares fall as supply chain havoc leads retailer to slash revenue forecast
SUMMARY: Nike shares dropped after the sneaker giant said supply chain congestion is hurting the business more than it previously anticipated.

TITLE: Stitch Fix shares surge as online styling service reports surprise profit
SUMMARY: Stitch Fix shares jumped after the online shopping and styling service reported a surprise profit for its fiscal fourth quarter.

TITLE: Oracle falls short on revenue as it ramps up cloud investment
SUMMARY: While Oracle has been investing more in capital expenditures to meet expected demand for cloud services, revenue fell short of estimates in multiple segments.

TITLE: Affirm stock skyrockets after company reports 71% revenue growth and strong guidance
SUMMARY: The blockbuster earnings report comes after Affirm last month announced it's teaming up with Amazon to launch a buy now, pay later checkout option on the site.

TITLE: Boston Beer falls nearly 10% as weak hard seltzer demand forces it to pull earnings guidance
SUMMARY: Boston Beer pulled its earnings guidance Wednesday amid a big slowdown in sales of Truly, its hard seltzer brand.

TITLE: GameStop falls more than 7% despite posting narrower loss and rising sales
SUMMARY: Shares of GameStop fell about 2% in extended trading on Wednesday even after the retailer said its second-quarter losses narrowed year over year.

TITLE: Lululemon shares surge on earnings beat, hiked outlook as shoppers spend on workout apparel
SUMMARY: Lululemon shares rose after the athletic apparel maker reported fiscal second-quarter profit and revenue that topped analysts' expectations.

TITLE: NFL data rights partner Genius Sports sees revenue double in the second quarter
SUMMARY: NFL data rights licensee Genius Sports said it made $55.8 million in revenue for the second quarter as its stock to a dive in after-hours trading.

TITLE: American Eagle shares drop after revenue falls short, e-commerce sales slow from last year
SUMMARY: American Eagle on Thursday posted mixed fiscal second-quarter results.

TITLE: Chewy shares tumble after pet retailer's earnings and forecast disappoint
SUMMARY: The online pet retailer's stock was down more than 11% at one point in after-hours trading Wednesday.

TITLE: Shares of semiconductor giant Samsung fall after it says third-quarter profit likely rose 28%
SUMMARY: Samsung said its operating profit for the quarter that ended in September was up 28% from a year ago to 15.8 trillion Korean won ($13.26 billion).

TITLE: Levi Strauss earnings beat as new denim styles drive sales growth, retailer raises outlook
SUMMARY: Although many apparel companies have been hit by global supply chain bottlenecks, Levi has fared well comparatively due to its diversified manufacturing.

TITLE: Pepsi earnings top estimates despite higher supply chain costs, company raises revenue forecast
SUMMARY: PepsiCo on Tuesday raised its full-year forecast after its quarterly earnings and revenue topped analysts' expectations.

TITLE: Ford's sales improving but still down by 27.4% in the third quarter
SUMMARY: The drastic fall was narrower than auto forecasters expected, but wider than the overall industry that was projected to be down between 13% and 14%.

TITLE: Salesforce fourth quarter guidance misses Wall Street expectations
SUMMARY: Salesforce said earnings per share for the December quarter would be between 72 and 73 cents, lower than Refinitiv analyst expectations of 81 cents.

TITLE: Eco-friendly shoemaker Allbirds posts wider loss despite 33% gain in quarterly sales; shares fall
SUMMARY: Allbirds' losses widened as the cost of opening stores and listing its stock weighed on its results.

TITLE: Gap shares crater 15% after retailer sees millions in lost sales from delayed product shipments, cuts its forecast
SUMMARY: Gap Inc. on Tuesday slashed its full-year outlook due to supply chain complications that put a damper on its third-quarter sales and took a bite out of profits.

TITLE: Nordstrom shares tumble more than 20% as earnings fall short, hurt by higher labor costs, weak Nordstrom Rack sales
SUMMARY: Nordstrom earnings fell short of analysts' expectations as labor costs ate into profits and sales struggled to return to pre-pandemic levels.

TITLE: Dick's Sporting Goods shares fall despite earnings beat and hiked outlook
SUMMARY: Dick's Sporting Goods on Tuesday reported fiscal third-quarter earnings and sales that outpaced analysts' expectations.

TITLE: Best Buy earnings top estimates but retailer's stock tumbles amid weakening demand, shipping bottlenecks
SUMMARY: Best Buy's fourth quarter could be hurt by rising shipping costs and weaker demand for consumer electronics.

TITLE: Zoom beats estimates even as revenue growth is poised to slow after pandemic
SUMMARY: Zoom indicated that revenue growth will slow to 19% in the current quarter, compared with over 300% growth last year following the onset of the coronavirus.

TITLE: Kohl's shares jump after retailer reports 16% sales increase as shoppers buy clothes and makeup
SUMMARY: The department store chain also raised its forecast for the year.

TITLE: Macy's shares surge on upbeat earnings, decision to hire AlixPartners to review business
SUMMARY: Macy's reported third-quarter earnings and sales that topped analysts' expectations, leading the department store chain to raise its full-year forecast.

TITLE: Alibaba shares drop 11% as its slashes guidance and earnings plunge on China's slowdown
SUMMARY: Alibaba has been a victim of China's crackdown on its technology industry which has seen a slew of new regulation brought in from antitrust to data protection.

TITLE: Nvidia data center sales grew 55% on demand for artificial intelligence chips
SUMMARY: Nvidia stock rose more than 5% in extended trading after it reported third-quarter earnings Wednesday that beat expectations for both earnings and sales.

TITLE: Cisco reports disappointing revenue and issues forecast that misses estimates
SUMMARY: Cisco CEO Chuck Robbins said the company saw strong demand despite supply challenges, but the company failed to meet analysts' revenue estimates.

TITLE: Lowe's tops estimates as customers invest more in bigger home projects, retailer lifts sales forecast
SUMMARY: The home improvement retailer has been making an effort to win more electricians, contractors and other professionals as customers.

TITLE: Target tops earnings estimates, but shares fall as retailer focuses on keeping customer prices low
SUMMARY: Target raised its fiscal fourth-quarter forecast, predicting comparable sales could rise at between a high single-digit and low double-digit pace.

TITLE: Walmart tops earnings estimates, wins back grocery shoppers as inflation heats up
SUMMARY: Walmart raised its forecast for the year and said it's using its size to navigate through rising costs.

TITLE: Home Depot earnings top estimates fueled by 9.8% jump in sales as consumers fix up homes
SUMMARY: Shares of Home Depot have climbed 39% this year, giving it a market value of $392 billion.

TITLE: Nike shares rise as earnings, sales top estimates, fueled by strong North American demand
SUMMARY: Nike CEO John Donahoe said the retailer is in a "much stronger competitive position" than it was pre-pandemic.

TITLE: Darden shares fall as CEO announces plans to retire; Olive Garden parent raises forecast despite planned wage hike
SUMMARY: Olive Garden parent Darden Restaurants announced that CEO Gene Lee will retire May 29.

TITLE: Adobe plunges 10% and has second-worst day in past decade on weak guidance
SUMMARY: Adobe's guidance for its fiscal first quarter badly missed analysts' estimates, sending the stock down more than 10%.

TITLE: Lowe's says pandemic-fueled home improvement demand could cool in year ahead
SUMMARY: During an analyst meeting, Lowe's Chief Financial Officer Dave Denton said the retailer is preparing for a "modest sector pullback in 2022."

TITLE: Lululemon earnings top estimates, but shares fall after retailer cuts forecast for Mirror sales
SUMMARY: Lululemon's stock gave up gains Thursday after the company slashed its sales expectations for Mirror, the at-home fitness device it acquired last year.

TITLE: Oracle swings to loss because of payment tied to dispute over former CEO Hurd's employment
SUMMARY: Oracle's results were clouded by a payment tied to the employment of Mark Hurd, previously co-CEO of the database software maker with current CEO Safra Catz.

TITLE: GameStop shares fall as video game retailer reports widening losses in third quarter
SUMMARY: GameStop shares fell after the video game retailer reported that its losses widened in the fiscal third quarter.

TITLE: Rent the Runway posts widening losses, as subscribers have yet to return to pre-pandemic levels
SUMMARY: Rent the Runway booked a wider fiscal third-quarter loss compared with 2020, as its sales shot up 66% year over year.

TITLE: Stitch Fix shares crater as retailer cuts forecast, despite topping earnings estimates
SUMMARY: Stitch Fix cut its revenue outlook for the fiscal year, saying that it faces ongoing supply chain pressures and is in a transition period for bringing on users.

TITLE: MongoDB shares jump as revenue growth accelerates
SUMMARY: While MongoDB continues to spend heavily in a competitive market, it's raising expectations for the quarter ahead.

TITLE: DocuSign plunges almost 30% after e-signature company issues weak fourth-quarter guidance
SUMMARY: DocuSign lost more than a quarter of its value after hours on Thursday following a disappointing forecast for the end of the year.

TITLE: Kay Jewelers parent Signet shares down as investors fear retailer will have trouble sustaining strong growth
SUMMARY: Amid ongoing global supply chain issues, Signet CEO Virginia Drosos said the retailer secured its holiday merchandise early this year.

TITLE: Dollar General tested a store for wealthier shoppers. Now, it will grow to 1,000 locations
SUMMARY: Dollar General plans to expand its Popshelf chain to about 1,000 locations. The new format helps the discounter attract suburban customers and drive up profits.

TITLE: Snowflake stock soars on strong revenue and Q4 guidance
SUMMARY: Shares of Snowflake were up more than 13% after it surpassed analyst expectations for third-quarter revenue and provided strong product revenue guidance.
